DOC.brief_title: Use The Spanner Temporary Prostatic Stent Alternative Urinary Catheter Achieve Bladder Drainage Men
DOC.criteria: Age > 45 year ; In urinary retention catheterize ( indwell intermittent ) less 180 day ; Documented diagnostic history ( within 180 day study ) detrusor contractility ( > = 15 cmH2O ) confirm via pressureflow test ; Negative Urinalysis Visit 1 ; Not candidate pharmacologic , minimally invasive surgical treatment prostate ; Charlson Weighted Index Comorbidity Score > = 1 ; Willing able sign Informed Consent Form ; Willing able complete followup protocol requirement ; Experiencing catheterinduced discomfort . Current use urinary catheter daily great 180 consecutive day immediately precede enter study ; Positive Urinalysis Visit 1 ; Current recent ( within last 6 month ) urinary tract disease include urethral stricture , bladder stone , significant urological condition surgery ; Surgery alter normal urogenital anatomy abnormal urethral anatomy affect function lower urinary tract ; History condition associate neurogenic bladder , include spinal cord injury , multiple sclerosis , Parkinson 's disease ; Use anticholinergic medication ; Gross hematuria catheter remove Visit 1 ; Known suspected prostate cancer ; Prior pelvic irradiation therapy ; Prostatic urethral length < 4 cm > 9 cm ( combined length top proximal side bladder neck bottom distal side external sphincter ) ; Intravesical enlargement median lobe prostate .
